page.title: 17Tomatoes and Cucumbers
page.content: Tomatoes are planted in the glass houses between December and March. They have to watered carefully, the amount given depending on the radiation figure. The side shoots are removed to help strenghten the main plant. When the tomatoes are picked they are graded, 1st class round and firm, 2nd class slightly blemished and mis-shapen, 3rd class heavily blemished and cracked. The first of the tomatoes are picked in March. The 1st class are packed into boxes and, after inspection, are put into refrigerated lorries and shipped to Portsmouth. The cultivation of cucumbers follows the same timing and procedure as for tomatoes, except that there are only two grades. 1st class no blemish and slightly curved, 2nd slightly blemished and curved.
